title: Memorial Park, Palmerston North
text:
Memorial Park is a multi-use <a href="stadium">stadium</a> in <a href="Palmerston%20North">Palmerston North</a>, <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a>. It is currently used mostly for <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> matches and was the home stadium of <a href="YoungHeart%20Manawatu">YoungHeart Manawatu</a> before they disbanded. The stadium has a capacity of 8,000 people.
The stadium hosted the final of the <a href="2011%20Chatham%20Cup">2011 Chatham Cup</a> on 28 August 2011. <a href="Wairarapa%20United">Wairarapa United</a> won the competition for the first time in their history, defeating <a href="Napier%20City%20Rovers%20FC">Napier City Rovers</a> 2–1. This is the first time that the final of New Zealand's premier knockout football competition has been held in Palmerston North.
In 2015 Central Football board member Bruce McGhie proposed a plan to the <a href="Palmerston%20North%20City%20Council">Palmerston North City Council</a> on making the ground an all-weather sports field. He stated that by 2019–20 Memorial Park would have a multi-purpose artificial sports field. The plan is set to cost $1.7 million.
